title: Mount Sugartop
text: Mount Sugartop () is a prominent, partly snow-covered <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, 2,325 m, standing 5 miles (8 km) northwest of <a href="Mount%20Paget">Mount Paget</a> in the <a href="Allardyce%20Range">Allardyce Range</a> of <a href="South%20Georgia%20Island">South Georgia</a>. The name "Sugarloaf Peak" has appeared on maps for this feature for many years, but the <a href="South%20Georgia%20Survey">South Georgia Survey</a>, following its 1951-52 surveying expedition, reported that the name Mount Sugartop is well established locally for this mountain. This latter name is approved on the basis of local usage.
